fields.description:
h3. Problem
When JSD integrate with AWS Service Catalog using the "AWS Service Catalog Connector for Jira Service Desk", automatically it created "Request AWS Product" request type. However, the user need to choose the "Product" first. If the user have a lot of account integrated ( for example 50) , they going to see a long list of product. It will be better to add *Account* field and allow user to select the "Account" first before selecting the product. This will be more easier for the customer.

h3. Why This Is Important
This will be more easier for the customer when the organization have a lot of account in AWS Service Catalog.


h3. Workaround
No workaround available at this time
fields.summary: Allow to choose the "Account" value before selecting the "Product" for "Request AWS Product" request type after integrating with AWS Service Catalog

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Updating the Satisfaction locked custom field with REST API endpoint succeeds only the first time

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Use the REST API endpoint: [Edit issue|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-issues/#api-rest-api-3-issue-issueidorkey-put] to update the *Satisfaction* custom field

h3. Expected Results
* Able to update the *Satisfaction* field every time the REST API endpoint is called

h3. Actual Results
* Succeeds the first time but subsequent updates return the 500 internal server error

h3. Workaround
* Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Updating the Satisfaction locked custom field with REST API endpoint succeeds only the first time

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, it's not possible to add _last updated by_ information to be displayed in an issue while in the queue at the Jira UI overview.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add _last updated by_ information in queues at the Jira UI overview the same way _days in issue_ field is currently possible to be displayed.
fields.summary: Add "Last updated by" information in issue queue at Jira UI

fields.description:
h3. Problem
When you only have one project, the customers will receive a signup link that redirects them to the portal URL of the project (/servicedesk/customer/portals/1) instead of the portal "main page" (/servicedesk/customer/portals).

h3. Suggested resolution
Have the ability to choose what URL will customers be redirected when there is only one project created.

h3. Workaround
Ask the customers to access the portal using the following URL https://<instance>.atlassian.net/servicedesk
fields.summary: Ability to control the URL customers will be redirected after finishing the sign up

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Currently, the only way to navigate within the portal is by using the breadcrumbs. To make it easier for anybody to navigate within the portal.
h3. Suggested resolution

Provide the ability to navigate within the portal with proper buttons like *Back* and *Next*
fields.summary: Improve the navigation within the portal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Based on [this|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/rest/api-group-requesttype/#api-group-requesttype] documentation, the request support pagination. However, currently it only able to return first 100 request type. When changing the "start" and "limit" value , it being ignore.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open Postman and trigger https://xxx.atlassian.net/rest/servicedeskapi/requesttype?start=51&limit=100

h3. Expected Results
The result start from the 51 request type

h3. Actual Results
It still return from the 1st request type :-
 !Screenshot 2020-08-17 at 9.15.14 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The "GET /rest/servicedeskapi/requesttype" REST API ignore "start" and "limit" value when "searchQuery" parameter blank

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Transitioning issues (from *Queues* screen) with _Comment_ validation fails

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# A workflow validator (_Field Required Validator_) is set on a transition. The required field is _Comment_
# Transitioning via the *JSD Queues - All Open* screen, enter the comment and update the tickets

h3. Expected Results
* The issues transition to the next status

h3. Actual Results
* The issues do not transition due to a failure on the comment validation

h3. Workaround
* Use the queue filter to search for the issues on the *Advanced issue search*
* Use the Bulk transition feature to transition the issues after entering the relevant comment and status
fields.summary: Transitioning issues (from the Queues screen) with Comment validation fails

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Granting the 'Browse Projects or Assign issues or Schedule issues or Add comments' permissions to the 'Service Desk Customers' role in a project with [login-free portal permissions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/migrating-to-login-free-portal-permissions-894661199.html] won't allow customers that don't have accounts to create tickets via e-mail or the portal.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure the Global and Project [*Customer Permissions*|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-desk-cloud/docs/choose-customer-permissions-for-your-service-desk-and-jira-site/] to allow anyone to create their own accounts and to send requests without logging in
 # Go to your *Project settings* > *Permissions* > *Actions* > *Edit permissions* and add the role 'Service Desk Customers' to the 'Browse Projects' permission
 # Send an email to your project's email account from an address that is not associated with an account yet *OR* go to the portal without being logged in, create a ticket and inform an e-mail address (not associated with any account) in the "Email confirmation to" field.

h3. Expected Results

In both cases, Jira will create a ticket and a new customer account.
h3. Actual Results

Ticket and customer account are not created and the error *Signup is not currently available* will appear in the portal / email logs.

!print.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
Remove the 'Service Desk Customers' role from the 'Browse Projects or Assign Issues or Schedule Issues or Add comments' permissions.

h3. Notes
This can also happen when the *Service project customer - portal access* is missing create issue and browse project permission, which prevents the customer from creating the issue from the portal, though the error message is misleading that the sign-up is not available.
fields.summary: Granting 'Browse Projects', 'Assign issues', 'Schedule issues', 'Create issues' or 'Add comments' permissions to the 'Service Desk Customers' role will make signup unavailable

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When you try to add a new request participant through the *customer portal*, Jira shows *No Options* if you just type the first letter. It starts displaying users if you type the second letter. You can see this behavior in the images below:
 !Screen Shot 2020-08-12 at 18.22.06.png|thumbnail! 

 !Screen Shot 2020-08-14 at 14.03.49.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a new request.
 # Try to share the ticket with a user and just type the first letter of their name.

h3. Expected Results
The search box should be able to find users by typing their first letters.
h3. Actual Results
Jira displays no options. 

 !Screen Shot 2020-08-12 at 18.22.06.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround

If you write at least two letter of a user's name, you will be able to find them.
fields.summary: When adding a new request participant via the customer portal, the search box doesn't show any users if you just type the first letter

fields.description: Our organization has multiple Service Desk projects and would like to create unique permissions in the portal so that users can only see the service desk that applies to them. This helps to prevent the portal search from suggesting request options for the wrong service desk and misdirecting requests. However, we would like to keep allowing email requests from anyone, from any email address, with no restrictions. Currently the permissions for the portal and for email requests are combined. Can they be separated into two different permissions options? The current configuration is preventing us from using the portal in the way that it is intended to be used.
fields.summary: Separate permissions for Portal and Email requests

fields.description:
An external Partner sends automated E-Mails to us. We need to convert those e-mails into Jira Service Desk tickets as we need to to some actions according to those e-mails. Therefore we configured e-mail Requests in one of our Jira Service Desk projects.

Expected behaviour:
Tickets are genereted from incomming e-mails if our external partner.

Actual bahavior:
Jira Service Desk recognizes the e-mails as mass e-mails and ignores them.

 

Proposition:
It should be possible to whiteliste certain domains so that e-mails are proceedet into tickets even tough Jira conciders them as mass e-mails
fields.summary: Allow preceeding of mass e-mails to Tickets

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

For a short period of time some of the approvals in next-gen JSD failed to be setup correctly impacting a limited number of customers. Frontend validation didn't work correctly, and users were able to set up multiple approvals in a single workflow, with all approvals using the same approver list field. This is normally not possible in Jira Service Desk next-gen projects.
h3. Steps to Reproduce (whilst bug was in production)
 # Set up an approval in a JSD next-gen project, using a specific approver list field for this approval.
 # Set up another approval step in the same workflow, and reuse the same approver list field as the first approval.

h3. Expected Results

You should not be able to use one approver list field across multiple approval steps within a single JSD next-gen workflow. You should need to create a new approver list field for each approval step within a workflow.
h3. Actual Results

The user was able to add multiple approval steps within a single workflow where all steps used the same approver list field.
h3. Workaround

This is issue is impacting a known number of instances - Support will reach out to the customers that need to be fixed manually
fields.summary: Next-gen JSD approvals have become faulty for some customers

fields.description: I would like to suggest Admins be added to Jira-Service-Desk-Users to provide a more consistent representation of the licenses being consumed.
fields.summary: Include Admins in Jira-Service-Desk-Users

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the "Email" value will choose the custom email as the project email request. However, there's a case administrator who would like to use the default email as the project email request and leave the custom email for another purpose. Below are the screenshot on which section would like to have the option to change it :-
 !Screenshot 2020-08-13 at 10.06.44 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
It will be best to be able to change the email channel value.

h3. Why this is important
Clear information to the project agents for which email to use or suggest to their external customers.
fields.summary: Ability to change the email at project "Channels" section

fields.description:
Hi eveyone,

I have a big problem with POST Api method for new Jira Issue... basically, I am always getting the error: "customfield_10402":"Customer Request Type field is required" even if I set value for it...I found a tons of links and tried everything, but cannot find correct value for that field...

I have tried by setting value as projectkey/nameOfRequestTypeField and nothing happens, and most of the links that are connected to servicedesk are not working for me...

!image-2020-08-13-12-41-13-628.png!

 

And if I set that field without jsd/ it gives me an error: "Invalid customer request value"... have no idea how to find correct value... :(
fields.summary: Customer Request Type field Rest API ISSUE

fields.description:
We are using JSD for internal support however if a user finds a ticket either in Jira Issue Search or when another internal team member (who is an agent) shares a link it gives them a permissions issue. 

Expected behavior is that it would redirect a user to the portal version of the issue (e.g. the requester view)

Example slugs:

[https://foursquare.atlassian.net/browse/PS2-235] should redirect to the following if a user is not a member of the service team:

[https://foursquare.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portal/19/PS2-235]
fields.summary: redirect jira urls to jsd portal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The *Knowledgebase* Tab in a Jira Service Desk displays the same set of articles when there is more than 1 Page of articles.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Link a Confluence space to a Jira Service Desk project which has more than 20 articles.
# Navigate to the Knowledge Base tab to view all the articles.
# Click on Page 2 at the bottom.
 !image-2020-08-12-22-02-41-305.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Clicking on Page 2 should take you to the next page of articles.
h3. Actual Results
It navigates to Page 2 but it does not load the next set of articles, instead it just shows the articles that we see in Page 1

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Knowledge base Tab does not load the pages properly

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While trying to add "System Automatic Ticket Creator Role" in the "Browse users and groups" global permission, the group does not populate in the dropdown until you type the full name
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a group called "System Automatic Ticket Creator Role"
 # Try to assign it a global permission by starting to type in the name

h3. Expected Results

When you start typing, say "system", the group is displayed in the drop-down.
h3. Actual Results

The group is not displayed. 
 !Screenshot 2020-08-12 at 12.39.53 PM.png|width=303,height=125!

Only when you enter the complete name, the group is shown in the dropdown
 !Screenshot 2020-08-12 at 1.13.43 PM.png|width=284,height=105!
h3. Workaround

Enter the complete name so that it is shown in the drop down
fields.summary: When searching for a group to grant global permission, it does not appear in the drop-down until you type the complete name

fields.description: ccc
fields.summary: SD

fields.description:
I've seen numerous support tickets referencing being able to export SLA values in a CSV format, and none of them seem to have been resolved.

The most recent I could find: JRACLOUD-62457

Was simply closed at the end of last year with no details on why the feature was removed to begin with, nor why it was canceled for consideration. Please provide a reason if we are not going to be able to export SLA values from Jira Cloud.

Or, make the enhancement.
fields.summary: Jira Cloud to include SLA Values in CSV Export

fields.description:
As an admin/reporter leveraging the Jira suites, I should be able to add SLA conditions base on the internal reply of my agents to track response times between one another and to add for reporting.

I can create SLA for responses to the customer, I wanted to create a report on replies between internal to internal vs internal to external on the customer portal.
fields.summary: Creating SLA base on internal replys as a condition

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When accessing a ticket with subtasks from the queue (e.g., with a URL like [https://nameofinstance.atlassian.net/jira/servicedesk/projects/ABC/queues/custom/1/ABC-123?oldIssueView=true]), the sub-task menu for each subtask doesn't work when clicked.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Visit a parent issue using the old issue view and with the queue version of the URL
 # Try to click on the context menu for a subtask (i.e., *...*)
 # Nothing happens

h3. Expected Results
When clicking the *...* next to a subtask, the menu should be present and able to be viewed.

h3. Actual Results
The *...* button highlights, but no menu is shown.

h3. Workaround
Use the non-queue URL (e.g., [https://nameofinstance.atlassian.net/browse/ABC-123?oldIssueView=true]) as it works as expected.
fields.summary: Accessing the parent issue from the queue using the old issue view prevents the sub-task context menu

fields.description:
When configuring approval statuses in JIRA Service Desk workflows, the buttons that display to the customer on the portal are always named *Approve* or *Decline*.

Although an approval has been specified in the workflow, this default text is certainly not always appropriate for our users. As such, an easy way to change this default text to anything that we wish would be very welcome for us, and I'm sure for many other users.
fields.summary: Ability to rename JIRA Service Desk approval buttons on customer portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem
When we integrate JSD to AWS, for multiple accounts, we have to provide configuration details manually each time


h3. Why This Is Important
If this is automated, instead of manually going to connector configuration and providing the parameters, we can pass the required parameters in a file to ease the process of connecting multiple accounts to JSD without requiring manual intervention each time

h3. Workaround
No workaround available at this time
fields.summary: Automating the integration of AWS account to JSD when using "AWS Service Catalog Connector for Jira Service Desk"

fields.description: We would love to see the ability to @ reference groups of people as opposed to only individual users. We often have multiple teams needing to work within a ticket and often end up having to @ reference all individual members of those teams. Ideally we could easily @ reference any of the assignment groups we've created within our project. thanks
fields.summary: Add the ability to @ reference groups

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When embedding a JSD Widget on a webpage will result in a 
ajs_group_id=null cookie being set. According to https://www.briskinfosec.com/blogs/blogsdetail/Null-Byte-SQL-Injection having the first cookie value set to null could sometimes be a bad thing.

In cases where the AWS SQLi protection rule is used, it will cause the Jira widget to get blocked due to having the first cookie ajs_group_id having a value of "null".

h3. Workaround
There is currently no known method to bypass this AWS rule, which seems to be a false positive.
fields.summary: Embedding JSD Widget on web page, first cookie set to ajs_group_id=null

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Some of macros (label macro, search macro, recently updated macros) are not working properly in KB articles. Instead of staying in the JSD KB page, those links would redirect the customer to the Confluence page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Confluence page with search macro (or any other macro mentioned above)
 # Render it in the KB view
 # Click it would redirect you to the Confluence page

h3. Expected Results

The customers should stay in JSD KB page
h3. Actual Results

Links redirect customers to the Confluence page
h3. Workaround

The customer could still see the content if having the permission
fields.summary: Macros in KB articles redirect customers to Confluence

fields.description: Would it be possible to give Jira administrators insight in messages which no longer being delivered? That would at least enable us to get insight into what is happening and provide our customers with swift follow up?
fields.summary: Notifications for outgoing emails that fails, bounced or blocked

fields.description:
How do I remove or disable loading all the article in a landing page? 

I want to see only when the user searches the content for the Confluence article, blogs etc. 

 

I can attach the screen captures if you like.
fields.summary: How to disable/remove suggested article.

fields.description:
{panel:title=(i) Bug Fix Policy| borderStyle=| borderColor=| titleBGColor=#e0efff| bgColor=}
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for the fix to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes bugfixes.
You can learn more by reading [Atlassian Cloud Bug Fixing Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-cloud-bug-fixing-policy-206865884.html].
{panel}

h3. Issue Summary

In Customer Portal, both Customers and Agents cannot upload a zero byte file.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a zero byte file like `touch sample.txt`
 # Upload the file via Customer Portal

h3. Expected Results

The zero byte files can be uploaded.

h3. Actual Results

Unable to upload a zero byte file.
The error on browser:

{code:none}
Uncaught TypeError: e is not a function
    at picker-facade.js:31
{code}

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Unable to upload a zero byte file via Customer Portal

fields.description:
When I go to my queue, it is not possible to see the issue detail after selecting an issue. I need to open the issue to check the detailed view on service desk projects.

I would like to view the issue detail when *selecting* an issue in the queue.
fields.summary: View issue detail when selecting an issue in the queue

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, for status changed customer notification it only allow to add the new status value using ${request.status} variable

h3. Suggested Solution
Ability to add the previous status value. For example :-

{noformat}
Grizz Frix changed the status from In Progress to Resolved.
{noformat}

h3. Why this is important
Clear information to customer when the issue status changed
fields.summary: Ability to add previous status value in customer notification for "Customer-visible status changed" action

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Some customers received invalid customer satisfaction links in the notification emails. The page was displaying an error saying Something bad happend
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Not reproducable
h3. Expected Results

N/A
h3. Actual Results

N/A
h3. Workaround

Check if the customer received other notification emails with valid links
fields.summary: Invalid customer satisfaction links in customer notification emails

fields.description: It would be awesome to have the ability to display announcements for Agents inside the project.
fields.summary: Announcements for Agents

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If the customer has the ticket open in the customer portal for a long time and then tries to attach an image, it will not load showing the following message:
 !Screen Shot 2020-07-30 at 16.26.22.png|thumbnail! 
This happens even if the customer has already written the message.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a request via the portal in Jira Service Desk.
 # Wait a few minutes before uploading an attachment.
# Try to upload the attachment and get the error message.

h3. Expected Results
The attachment should be uploaded.
h3. Actual Results
The attachment fails to upload.

h3. Workaround
The customer has to refresh the page and then upload the attachment again
fields.summary: Attachment fails to load when the customer has the request open in the customer portal for a long time

fields.description:
When sending an email to raise a ticket in Jira Service Desk or reply to a notification to add a comment with attachments over *25 MB*, we get a response from *bounce@atlassian.net* saying that the *Mailbox is not found*.

This is quite misleading as the mailbox does exist and the mail is in fact bounced due to *exceeding* the *size limit*. Hence the email fails to get processed and we do not see anything in the JSD Email handler logs too.

Hence raising this FR to provide a better error description.
fields.summary: Provide a better error description when the attachment size is over the limit for incoming email

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Few Emoticons are not being rendered properly in comments in the Customer portal and display only the emoticons text instead and this looks unprofessional.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Use Emoticons and add a comment in *Jira*
 !image-2020-07-29-21-16-32-563.png!
 # View the same comment in the *customer portal*
 !image-2020-07-29-21-17-08-011.png!

h3. Expected Results

The emoticons should reflect as it is in the customer portal comment section too.
h3. Actual Results

The emoticons are getting converted to their respective texts.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Adding emoticons are not rendering properly in the portal for customers

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Emoticons are not rendering in Customer portal for Jira service desk

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add emoticons in the JSD ticket.
 # Try the portal view and emoticons shows in text and doesn't render.  

h3. Expected Results
Emoticons should be rendering in the portal view as well. 

h3. Actual Results

Emoticon's doesn't load.

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Emoticons are not rendering in Customer portal for Jira service desk

fields.description:
Currently, when an administrator updates the *Portal settings* under *Project settings*, it only updates the primary language, but not the other languages the project has available.

It's understandable that we may not want to automatically try to translate text in language translation templates, but at the very least, it may be a good idea to have a notification or color-coded text box informing the administrator to also update the text in their other language translations under the *Language support* section of their project.
fields.summary: Alert or remind administrators to update translations when modifying portal text

fields.description:
h3. *Problem:*

When using the Jira app, we can edit some fields on tickets, but currently, the Request type can't be changed.

Also, when creating new tickets, it's not possible to creating using Request types (as the web version), only using Issue types.
h3. *Suggestion:*

The Request type is an important field on Service Desk, so it should be possible to edit it when using the mobile/MacOS app.
fields.summary: Support Request type on Jira mobile and MacOS app

fields.description:
Today, we have the variable ${recipient.name} to display the full name of the person receiving the email.

It would be great if we had another variable that displays only the first name of the person receiving the email.
fields.summary: Add a notification variable to only display the first name of the recipient

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when you create a [SAML integration|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/saml-single-sign-on-943953302.html] and configure it to be used by the _Portal-only users_ too (migrating their portal accounts to an Atlassian Account with no application access) when the user enters his/her email address, a button appears to redirect them to the Identity Provider to be authenticated.
!portal.png|thumbnail!

It is an additional (an unnecessary) step until the user is able to access the product. 

*Note:* more details about the difference between a _Portal_ account and an Atlassian Account can be found [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/manage-jira-service-desk-customer-accounts-913213935.html].
 
h3. Suggested Solutions
Create a feature to automatically redirect the SAML users to the Identity Provider side after the email information is fulfilled as it happens at https://id.atlassian.com.
fields.summary: Automatically redirect a 'Portal-only Customer' to the Identity Provider log in page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Projects in the help center are not shown in alphabetic order

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to an instance that does not have a next-gen service desk enabled
# Create a service desk project named XYZ
# Create a service desk project named ABC
# Navigate to the help center

h3. Expected Results
The projects are shown in the order as ABC -> XYZ

h3. Actual Results
The projects are shown in the order as XYZ -> ABC

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Projects in the help center are not shown in alphabetic order

fields.description:
Currently, when an administrator updates the email template for notifications, it only updates the primary language email template for customers, but not the other languages the project has available.

It's understandable that we may not want to automatically try to translate text in language translation templates, but at the very least, it may be a good idea to have a notification or color-coded text box informing the administrator to also update the template in their other language translations under the *Language support* section of their project.
fields.summary: Inform administrators that changes to customer notification templates will need to be updated in the language support section as well

fields.description:
Currently jira can send notification to all approvers by using Jira Autmation. However jira can't send notification specific approvers who have not approve yet.
I would be nice if Jira has ability to notify only users who have not approve when multiple approvers fields are set.
fields.summary: Ability to notify only users who have not approve

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a new user joins the site via self sign up, the first login lands the end user to the service desk portal page instead of loading Jira or Confluence. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On site with Jira Service Desk, Jira Software and Confluence, allow users from any domain or specific domain to join (site-access settings)
 # In Product Access settings, enable Jira Software / Confluence for new users. 
 # As a new user, access the site. 
 # Join the site. 

  !JOIN1.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Expected Results

After joining, Jira Software or Confluence should load for the end user. 

h3. Actual Results

The end user is redirected to the service desk portal page. 

 !JSD.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround

On the same browser tab, access the site home page again to load Jira Software or Confluence (ie. https://site.atlassian.net)
fields.summary: Self sign up accounts land incorrectly to the service desk portal page

fields.description:
I know we have tempo for billing but it would be nice to have other and more specific portal payment integrations like Stripe, Square etc. 

I use Atlassian for MSP purposes and it would be nice to allow my customers to come to the portal and submit a ticket but also make payment and not have to go to another place to make payments. 

I don't know if this is on the road map but to make Atlassian/ Jira Service Desk more usable for all businesses this would be very helpful.
fields.summary: Portal payment integrations

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

New reports not showing correctly in Service Desk Free sites.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new report on a Service Desk project (Classic or Next-gen).
 # Add a series and save.

h3. Expected Results

Even if the report is empty, with no data, it should be visible after refreshing the page.
h3. Actual Results

If we refresh the page or after creating the report we go to another page, like "Your work", Dashboards, Filters and we go back to the Reports' page, the new report is not visible.

It shows correctly in the database, but not on the UI.

!Screen Recording 2020-07-24 at 03.56 PM.gif|width=452,height=239!
h3. Workaround

Change the ID on the URL, for example,   [https://xxxxxxx.atlassian.net/jira/servicedesk/projects/IT/reports/custom/*40*] change to *41* to load the new report, after that, the new report should load normally. Like this:
!Recording #113.mp4|thumbnail! [^Recording #113.mp4] 


If the report is empty, sometimes just adding some data, like creating/resolving tickets, it will make the reports visible again.
fields.summary: New reports not showing correctly in Service Desk Free sites

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In the Next-Gen Service Desk project when there is a rule configured in a transition to add a label to the label field. It is not appending those labels, rather it is clearing the labels field and adding the label mention in the rule.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
#  Open a Next-Gen Service desk project.
# Open a Request Type and edit workflow.
# Add a rule to a transition to add labels to the label field. Ex. *Label A*
# Configure the above for the next transition. Ex *Label B*
# Now create a ticket and do a transition for that ticket, you will notice *Label A* being added to the label field.
# Now do the second transition, you will notice that *Label A* is *removed* and *Label B* is added to the label field

h3. Expected Results
Labels should be appended when new labels are being added from a rule in a transition
h3. Actual Results
Labels are getting replaced

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Rule for adding label in a workflow not appending labels in a Next-Gen Service Desk project.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In Jira Service Desk article, when a knowledgebase page contains a children display macro where the 'Show descendant' box is ticked, the description will show up as "all = true" when searching for the article in the portal or in the JIRA service desk knowledgebase page.

 !Description shown as all=true.png|thumbnail! 

Further investigation shows that this occurs when we tick the 'Show descendant' box in Confluence :
 !Show descendant.png|thumbnail! 

Inspecting the element shows the body parameter: all = true 
 !inspect element.png|thumbnail! 

From confluence we can see that the body parameter is actually set as all:true
 !inspect element (confluence).png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page with children display macro (page must be set in space for knowledgebase article in Jira service desk project)
 # Edit the macro and tick the 'Show descendant' box
 # Publish the page
 # Go to jira service desk portal and search for the article with the title 
 # View the description set

h3. Expected Results
The description should show as empty or content from other than children display macro

h3. Actual Results
Shows as all = true


h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Setting 'Show descendant' for children display macro will show up as all = true as the description in JSD article

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
For the "GET /rest/servicedeskapi/servicedesk/{serviceDeskId}/customer" API , when user query using accountID , the result return more than one when the user have matching displayName

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create two different customer accounts with the same display name
# Search for a customer using `/rest/servicedeskapi/servicedesk/{serviceDeskId}/customer?query={accountId}`


h3. Expected Results
Only one user returned , which is the user with the accoundID

h3. Actual Results
Two users will be returned. The one matching the provided accountId, and the customer who has a matching display name

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: "GET Customer" REST API return more than one result when query with accountID

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, once the widget is enabled at any point in time and disabled later we can always see the Validation error message.

!Screenshot 2020-07-15 at 22.02.05 (1).png|width=251,height=195!
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide the ability to hide/remove this message
h3. Why this is important

To help admins keep the service desk clean without configuration errors.
h3. Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: Ability to hide the validation error message from the widget configuration page

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently , only JIRA Software and Business project have "Project Archive" feature based on https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-1450 ticket already closed.

It will be great to implement the same for JIRA Service Desk project.
h3. Suggested Solution

Enable project archive for JIRA Service Desk project
h3. Why this is important

Give admin option to archive JIRA Service Desk project
h3. Workaround

This has been implemented.
fields.summary: Implement Project Archive and Trash feature for JIRA Service Management project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The gadgets: 

- Average Time in Status
- Average Age Chart

Don't display any information for JSD Next-gen projects.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create tickets on a JSD Next-gen project
 # Create a dashboard and related a gadget ( Average Time in Status or Average Age Chart ) that includes the JSD Next-gen ticket on the search

h3. Expected Results

Results are displayed at the gadget.

h3. Actual Results

No results:

 !reports.png|thumbnail! 

Also, if you click on *issues* link of the *Average Age Chart* gadget it'll display the issues of the search. 

h3. Workaround

It's working on JSD Classic projects, therefore customers may consider moving to Classic projects as per [Migrate between next-gen and classic projects|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/migrate-between-next-gen-and-classic-projects/].
fields.summary: Average Time in Status and Average Age Chart don't work for Jira Service Desk Next-gen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-17520].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, users who have a project with more than 1 Leader can't add multiple project lead into Jira projects.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow project administrators to add multiple Project Leads into a Jira Project. 

h3. Workaround
At this time there's no workaround.
fields.summary: Ability to add multiple project leads

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Knowledge base articles are not showing up as results of the Widget search engine even if the "Allow search for knowledge base articles" is enabled.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a login-free portal and link it to a Confluence space.
 ** Set the knowledge base *Viewing* access is set to *Anyone*.
 ** Provide Anonymous Access with the View permission in the linked Confluence space.
 # Enable the Widget in your project, turning on the option "Allow search for knowledge base articles".
 # Embed the Widget in any site.
 # Search for an article's title.

h3. Expected Results

The article will show in the search results.
h3. Actual Results

The search won't find any article, showing only request types appear in the results.

!print.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

No workaround available at this moment.
fields.summary: KB articles don't show up in the Widget search

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, there’s no way to hide the KB categories from the portal even if the permissions allow only licensed users to view the articles.


h3. Suggested Solution

Provide the ability to hide the KB Categories from the portal view when the Knowledgebase is used only by licensed users.
Also include the possibility to hide knowledgebase categories if the category is either empty or the user has no permissions to view articles in that category.

h3. Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Ability to hide the KB categories from the portal view

fields.description: In the customer portal view of requests, there is a single field for "Shared With" that includes both Request Participants *AND* Organizations. This has been confusing to our customers. In the agent issue view, these are separated out. The suggestion is to separate out "Organizations" and "Request Participants" in the customer view.
fields.summary: Clarify Shared With in Customer Portal

fields.description:
Suggested articles are shown based on what the user types in the summary. 

This suggestion is to include the ability to select some suggestions articles based on request type.

We can see this feature in this [demo |https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dBvHe_Q36g4] at 00:48 seconds when even before the user start typing the summary we can see a suggested article.

Currently the only way to implement this solution is through this [kb|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confeval/jira-service-desk-evaluator-resources/jira-service-desk-display-a-specific-article-for-a-request-type], I see this as a workaround but we would expect to have this built-in in the tool.
fields.summary: Add the ability to pre-define suggested articles per request type

fields.description:
It would be easy to understand for customer if we can add a description to "Share with" filed like other fields.
 !スクリーンショット 2020-07-20 18.08.25.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Ability to add a description to "Share with" filed in Customer portal

fields.description:
h2. Problem Definition

As Jira Service Desk portal doesn't support changing the default value of `Share with` in the portal request form, and it's prone to be overlooked by the user as it's at the bottom of the form.
h2. Suggested Solutions

Add the ability to change the position to the top of the form.
fields.summary: Ability to change position of `Share with` in portal request form

fields.description:
For business reasons could happens to have different SLAs for different periods over the year.

e.g. an SLA valid for April to August (becuse the customer top period is over the summer) and another more relaxed SLA valid from August to March.
fields.summary: SLA Calendars: add the validity start and end date of a specific calendar

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently not all the JSD REST API endpoints support Oauth2. Indeed, while for many of them you can see that the Oauth scope is documented: 
{quote}*OAuth scopes required*:  {{manage:servicedesk-customer}}
{quote}
 

For others (like the below ones) this is missing and an error is returned while trying to call them using 3LO:
 * [Get info|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/rest/api-group-info/#api-rest-servicedeskapi-info-get] /rest/servicedeskapi/info
 * [Get articles|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/rest/api-group-knowledgebase/#api-rest-servicedeskapi-knowledgebase-article-get] /rest/servicedeskapi/knowledgebase/article
 * [Get all request types|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/rest/api-group-requesttype/#api-rest-servicedeskapi-requesttype-get] /rest/servicedeskapi/requesttype

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Send a REST API request to the  [/rest/servicedeskapi/requesttype|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/rest/#api-rest-servicedeskapi-requesttype-get] endpoint using 3LO authorization

h3. Expected Results

A list of request types is returned
h3. Actual Results

The below error is returned:
{noformat}
{"errorMessages":["OAuth 2.0 is not enabled for this method."]}
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Use any other authentication method for the time being.
fields.summary: Add support for Oauth2 (3LO) for all JSD REST API endpoints

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition

When public signup is enabled, I can restrict portal access at a per project level by setting "Customers my team adds to the project" or "Anyone can send a request...".

These two settings do not allow me to configure specific portal access for customers by their domain. This is problematic when I have different JSD projects serving different sets of customers who shouldn't be able to access each other's portal.
h3. Suggested solution

Add a third option under Customer Permissions which lets admins configure "Anyone belonging to \{some-domain} can send a request".

 
h3. Workaround

Set all projects to "Customers my team adds to the project" and manually manage customers without using self-signup.

This, unfortunately, is a very tedious process for large groups of customers who have to be added to a project, or if new customers need to be constantly signed up (from the allowed domain) and added to a project.
fields.summary: Allow restricting portal access by customer domain

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an e-mail request attaching a non-image file with an '@' in the file name
 # Observe the results

h3. Expected Results

A clickable thumbnail that can be previewed and downloaded is added to the comments section.

!print.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

An invalid link is added to the comments section.

!print2.png|thumbnail!
h3. Additional Notes

Even though the link in the comments is not valid, files are attached successfully and can be accessed in the old issue view (only available in Classic projects).

!print3.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Rename the file before creating the email request.
fields.summary: Non-image e-mail attachments that have an '@' symbol in the file name are not rendered in the comments section

fields.description:
Can JIRA change automatically the length of file name so it could be attached to the task? At the moment JIRA automatocally changes the file name of attachemnts in emails if there are prohibited symbols.
'\', '/','\"', '%', ':', '$', '?', '*' are changed to "_".
fields.summary: Can JIRA change automatically the length of the file name so it could be attached to the task?

fields.description:
When searching on the customer portal, request types show up and can be selected. While this is a great feature, sometimes it can result in customers using the wrong request type.

It would be nice if the ability existed to exclude request types based on certain keywords. For example, if this feature existed, the request types page could have another link like *Edit fields* or *Edit groups* called something like *Edit keywords* and then words in the blocklist could prevent the request type from showing in results where those strings are used. Conversely, this could also be used to prioritize results as well where an allowlist ensures that the request type will be shown in results where strings are matched from the allowlist.
fields.summary: Ability to hide (or prioritize) request types in portal search results

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When rendering a Confluence page in a KB view, the links generated from the Recently updated macros are invalid.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Confluence page with a recently updated macro
 # Render it in the KB view
 # Links will lead to a 404 page

h3. Expected Results

Links will direct users to the Confluence page
h3. Actual Results

Links lead to a 404 page
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Recently updated macros render invalid links in KB articles

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Table formatting is lost when sending an email to a JSD email channel.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable 'HTML email parsing' in the Email request settings
 # Ensure the 'Wiki style renderer' is configured for the description field
 # Send an email with a formatted table in the email body to a JSD email channel

h3. Expected Results

Table displays correctly in the issue view description field.

This is the content of the original email:

!image-2020-07-14-12-34-17-717.png|width=219,height=61!
h3. Actual Results

Formatting is stripped.

This is how the table gets displayed in the description field of the issue view:

!image-2020-07-14-12-35-31-180.png|width=582,height=95!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Table formatting on incoming emails get stripped when rendered in the issue view

fields.description:
When adding a customer to a project, they are added to the *People* page as a *Service Desk Customer*. If the user is later added to a customer organization and then removed from the customer organization/customer organization deleted/removed from the project, the user remains present in the *People* page as a *Service Desk Customer*.

It would be nice if when removing a customer from a project, if there was an option to check the *People* page and remove them from there as well.
fields.summary: When removing a customer from an organization, provide option to remove them from the People list if that account is there as well

fields.description:
[https://bulldog.internal.atlassian.com/browse/DCA-546]

 

*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Navigate to [https://submission-system-staging.atlassian.net/]
 # Login into the system as <customer>
 # Select "Data Center approval" section
 # Select "Jira DC App review"/"Confluence DC App review"/"Bitbucket DC App review" section
 # Scroll to the bottom of the form
 # Click on the "Send" button (make sure that required fields are empty)
 # Scroll up through the form - error messages are shown for required text fields
 # Fill any required text field

*Actual result:*
 The error message under the required field ("Please provide a valid value for required field <field name>") is not dismissed after filling it.

*Expected result:*
 The error message under the required field should be dismissed after filling it.

!image-2020-07-13-17-28-26-227.png!
fields.summary: Error messages are not dismissed after filling the empty required text fields

fields.description:
[https://bulldog.internal.atlassian.com/browse/DCA-548]




*Steps to reproduce:*
 # Navigate to [https://submission-system-staging.atlassian.net/]
 # Login into the system as <customer>
 # Select "Data Center approval" section
 # Select "Jira DC App review"/"Confluence DC App review"/"Bitbucket DC App review" section
 # Scroll to the bottom of the form
 # Click on the "Send" button (make sure that the "App name" field is empty)
 # Scroll up through the form to the "App name" field

*Actual result:*
The error message is shown under the "App name" field: "Please provide a valid value for field 'App name'".

*Expected result:*
The error message should be shown under the "App name" field: "Please provide a value for required field 'App name'".

Note: It would be good to add the article "the" for these messages. Example: "Please, provide a value for the required field <field name>".

*FYI:* This issue you can see also inside Support and Escalation sections

!image-2020-07-13-17-25-55-518.png!
fields.summary: Submission form | The word "required" is missed in the error message under the App name field

fields.description:
Given the enhancements made available to Safari as explained at [Full Third-Party Cookie Blocking|https://webkit.org/blog/10218/full-third-party-cookie-blocking-and-more/], cross-site tracking is disabled by default in recent versions of Safari.

This feature is now affecting third party apps that rely on Third-Party Cookie (e.g. using the current user's session to load content such as knowledge base articles within an iframe embedded in a vendor's web site).

As part of this enhancements, it's expected to have cross-site tracking disabled by default by other browsers too.

There's already use cases that rely on Atlassian's cookies which are already being affected in Safari and will be affected soon on other web browsers.

This blog post from webkit has some interesting suggestions on how to circumvent this issue: https://webkit.org/blog/10218/full-third-party-cookie-blocking-and-more/
fields.summary: Third-party cookie blocking in Safari

fields.description:
Currently, it's not possible to open a subtask directly clicking anywhere under its parent issue like shown [here|https://share.getcloudapp.com/nOue2lJZ] on the issue details views.

The only possibility is clicking on its issue-key.

It would be awesome to open it clicking anywhere.
fields.summary: Only opening subtasks clicking on its issuekey

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Currently, Jira Service Desk customers rely only on email notifications to be on top of updates on their tickets.  

h3. Proposed solution

Just like in Jira, It would be great to have a "notification bell" to alert customers of updates on their requests.
fields.summary: Notification bell on the customer portal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Accessing a Software issue from the linked issues section of a Service Desk issue will reload the page and show the Software issue information, but when you move back to the Service Desk issue through the linked issues, the Service Desk issue information will be gone.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Link a Service Desk to a Software issue;
# Access the Software issue from the linked issues section of the Service Desk one;
# Move back to the Service Desk issue through the linked issues section;
# Repeat the same steps a couple of times.

h3. Expected Results
Jira should load each issue's information once it is accessed from the linked issues section.

h3. Actual Results
Jira will show the wrong information when accessing the Service Desk issue.
- https://share.getcloudapp.com/BluOvNkN

h3. Notes
It is easier to reproduce on Firefox than it is on Chrome.

h3. Workaround
- Reload the Service Desk issue page or open on a new tab.
fields.summary: Moving to a Software issue from the linked issues will hide Service Desk information when moving back

fields.description:
I know this sugestion has been submitted a couple times, but this feature is absolutely useless without some configuration available to the admin. Currently, when a customer is only part of one organization, the service desk portal form defaults to "share with" that organization. The only work arounds at the moment are to either put the customer in 0 organizations, or more than one organization. This doesn't make sense at all and limits the feature almost entirely from use in our implementation. In my opinion, you should either provide some configuration regarding whether it defaults to their only organization or completely turn this off.

!image-2020-07-09-08-24-41-495.png!
fields.summary: Default Organization

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Currently, it's not possible to select the protocol for *Google* and *Microsoft* connections when configuring the JSD Mail Handler. By default, the *IMAP* protocol is enforced for the connection, and this is not known by most of the users.
h3. Suggestion

Add a *Select Box* to users choose between *IMAP* or *POP* protocols, the same ways it's showed for the *Other* option in JSD Mail Handler.

*Actual*:
 !actual.png|thumbnail!

*Suggestion*:
 !suggestion.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

To be able to select the protocol, users need to select the *Other* connection option, which will allow the selection of *Protocols and Ports.*
fields.summary: Add the ability to choose between POP or IMAP in JSD Mail Handler configuration

fields.description:
As you allow to have a context for each project in custom field definition please allow automation to show only values from project context and not all values [or add switch - all /context] For example let say we have Customer Priority custom field with 2 context - Project 1 3 values - High, Medium, Low and Project2 as another context - Priority P1, Priority P2, Priority P3 ad priority P4.

When we create automation in Project 1 and check filed condition  [one of or equal] automation show a list of 7 values: High, Medium, Low +  Priority P1, Priority P2, Priority P3 ad priority P4.

If there will be longer list of values [as many project have own context this list can be very long]

Suggestion - make a switch project context/ all to allow user select only values from project context or all values.
fields.summary: New Automation - custom field condition - show value only from project context/show all values switch

fields.description:
As a licensed Service Desk user that is NOT a Service Desk agent (role) in a given project, I would like to be able to create issues into that project and set the Reporter field (Request on Behalf of) to someone other than me.

Currently a user needs to have "Service Desk Agent" permission in the target project to create an issue for that project WITH the Reporter set.  Without that permission, the issue sets themselves as the Reporter.  Often teams need to create Issues for other projects/teams on behalf of an end user, but they cannot do it upon create.  "Modify Reporter" does not provide this capability.

To recreate:
 # Log in as a user that has a Service Desk license but is NOT set as "Service Desk Team" for ProjectX.  Permission scheme for ProjectX has OOB rights: Admins and Service Desk Team.
 # Create a new issue in ProjectX.  The "Raise Request on behalf of" is not visible.  Create issue.
 # User cannot edit Reporter after the fact, even if given Modify Reporter permission.
fields.summary: Create Permission to set Reporter when a new issue is created

fields.description:
Hello,

We often notice reporters struggling with taking the extra steps to review their ticket and adding the right watchers after they created the ticket. Would / do you consider adding the watcher selection right within the forms for the creation of a service desk ticket?

Thanks!
fields.summary: Adding watchers during ticket creation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Inline Edit is disabled in the general configuration. However, allows us to edit the fields in the view issue on all Jira service desk project


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 Disable "Inline Edit" from JIRA General Configuration.
Try to edit issues from the view issue field. You will be able to edit all the fields.

h3. Expected Results
The view issue field should not allow editing of the fields as the Inline edit is disabled
h3. Actual Results
 Allows editing of the fields


h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Inline edit configuration is not working as expected

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Expand macros in KB articles are expanded by default, which can make a page very difficult to read.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new Confluence page with an expand macro
 # View the page as a KB article in Jira Service Desk and notice that all the expand macros are already expanded

h3. Expected Results

Expand macros are all collapsed by default
h3. Actual Results

Expand macros are all expanded by default
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Expand macros on KB pages are all expanded by default

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When raising a request from the portal as an agent, it is possible to "Raise this request on behalf of" another customer or user. If that user is added to an organization, the agent is able to choose if the issue will be shared with the organization using the "Share With" button or not, but when the chosen user is an Atlassian Account, the "Share With" button will disappear from the page. The same doesn't happen when the account is a portal-only.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an organization;
# Add two accounts to it, a portal-only account and an Atlassian account;
 !Screen Shot 2020-07-03 at 10.49.20.png|thumbnail! 
# Access the portal as an agent and alternate the "Raise this request on behalf of" between both accounts.

h3. Expected Results
Since both accounts are added to the organization, the "Share With" button should appear selecting both accounts.

h3. Actual Results
Selecting the portal-only account will show the "Share With" button while selecting the Atlassian Account won't.
- https://share.getcloudapp.com/NQugWLOd

h3. Workaround
Raise the issue without the organization and from inside Jira (agent view), add the organization.
fields.summary: "Raising a request on behalf of" will not show the "Share With" organizations dropdown when the chosen user is an Atlassian Account

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Browser detection of the current user's language to be supported in non-anonymous-access portals for CSAT links. 
This is a common flow for email-only customers as they may never actually log into Jira or the portal.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a non-anonymous-access portal with French translations enabled
 # Complete a ticket raised by some portal-only user (language of that user is irrelevant)
 # Open the CSAT link from the resulting email as an anonymous user with your browser language set to French - as if the portal-only customer is email-only and so never really logs in.

h3. Expected Results

The CSAT form is in French
h3. Actual Results

The CSAT form is in the project default language because it is not open to anonymous access and the language detection algorithm cannot determine that french is translatable for the project due to lack of permissions for anonymous users in that project.
h3. Workaround

Open at least one JSD portal up to anonymous access if it supports the desired language.
fields.summary: Customer satifaction page detecting supported languages for the portal for users who aren't logged in

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Pre-filled value is not working for select list

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a request type that has a _Single Select list_ custom field
# Create a custom URL passing a default value for the select list
{noformat}
servicedesk/customer/portal/8/create/47?summary=test&customfield_100XX=SELECT_LIST_OPTION_ID
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results
You should be able to submit the request just fine.

h3. Actual Results
Despite the value is shown on the select list, when we try to submit the request the field value is blank and the user needs to manually select the field value. 
 !error.gif|width=550! 


h3. Workaround
Select field value manually
fields.summary: Pre-filled value is not working for select list

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira Service Desk Cloud allows you to upload a logo image for the project. This logo appears in the customer portal. Changing this logo though is not an immediate result. Instead it has been observed that changing from one existing logo to another will commonly take 5-6 minutes before any end user will see that new logo
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Jira Service Desk classic project
 # In the project settings -> Portal settings, go to the Logo section
 # upload an image here, crop, and save
 # confirm that you see this image in the customer portal
 # Return to the portal settings page
 # Click the change logo button
 # upload a completely different image this time
 # Check the customer portal for the updated logo

h3. Expected Results

We expect that this logo will change immediately on the site.
h3. Actual Results
 * Customer portal view: Instead the customer portal does not update for at least 5-6 minutes.
 * Jira admin view of portal settings page will still show the old logo at first. Waiting 5 minutes after a logo change appears to be necessary in order to see the logo that was uploaded.
 * Attempting to do a hard refresh (shift + reload page) does not have any affect on the image that is loaded.  This should be sufficient to correct the problem if it was solely a cache problem in the browser end, but it appears that Jira Cloud is holding onto the previous logo for upwards of 5-6 minutes.

 
h3. Workaround

In Chrome, enable inspect network activity. Ensure that the "Disable cache" is enabled and upload the logo again.
fields.summary: Changing a project logo does not take effect immediately

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When inviting a customer in the Invite Customer dialog, if the email address belongs to a user who already exists but has had their access to the site revoked (making them inactive), then an error message appears. However, the error in the UI does not match the error response for the validation call in the Network console.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a user (Atlassian account or Customer account) on a site
 # Go to Site Administration, find the user, and revoke access
# Go to a Jira Service Desk Project > Customers tab in the project
# Click Invite Customers to open the dialog
# Type the email address of the user in steps 1+2 and click enter

h3. Expected Results
The user appears in the dialog with an error. Clicking on the red cross icon shows an error message saying the user is inactive and must be activated before they can be invited as a customer on the project.

h3. Actual Results
The user appears in the dialog with an error. Clicking on the red cross icon shows an error message saying "<email> is not a valid email address". This is misleading and confusing for users.

h3. Workaround

Users could open the Network tab and inspect the response to confirm that the reason the user cannot be invited is because they are inactive
 !image-2020-07-02-12-56-04-890.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Inviting an inactive user through the Invite Customer dialog shows an incorrect error message

fields.description:
Adam Hynes thankfully implemented the [Pre-filled values for fields in a request|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-133].  This was a huge gap that existed in the Jira Service Desk customer portal.  Now we can send someone a form link and pre-fill values that we already know about our own customers (the service plan they are on, their email address, any relevant custom field values, etc.).  It is wonderful!

_Example of parameters:_

/servicedesk/customer/portal/2/group/22?summary=This+is+awesome&description=So+glad+we+can+supply+parameters+and+pre-fill+values&email=coolcustomer@gmail.com&customfield_123=test

_However_, if your customer navigates to another part of the portal (switches request type or back to the search of the portal), all of these super helpful parameters are cleared.

 

*Acceptance Criteria*
 * URL query parameters supplied in a URL are maintained as the user navigates across the service desk
 ** At the very least, switching a request type should keep the parameters, but they really should follow you throughout
 * If the user navigates to another screen that uses parameters, they are appended to the ones in your URL to maintain that functionality
 ** Login screen has parameters that should maintain what was supplied
 *** ?destination=portal%2F2%2Fgroup%2F22
 ** Requests page has parameters
 *** ?page=1&status=open
 ** Approvals page has parameters
 *** ?approvalQueryType=myApproval&page=1

If you must clear the parameters when the user goes to the Login, Requests, or Approvals pages, that is fine as a first implementation.  We really just need users to be able to switch between request types, groups and portals within the instance, with request types being the most important to maintain the parameters.

The most common use-case is that a customer will land into a specific portal, drill down into a group (if you have groups), then into a request type.  We want to be able to send them to that top level and have the parameters follow them down each level and be maintained as they navigate around.
fields.summary: Preserve URL Parameters Across JIra Service Desk Portal

fields.description:
Currently, we can change the Updated field format on the New Issue View from relative to absolute, but that is only available on the actual issue view.

On queues, the field is always displayed as an absolute date only. To have a better visibility of _when_ tickets were updated, it'd be optimal to have a more specific information being shown such as "x hours ago" as opposed as "today's date".
fields.summary: Allow the "Updated" field to be displayed in a Relative format on queues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When viewing the results of a report in *Jira Service Desk*, subtasks show their parent's issue key as the subtask *Summary*.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a subtask
 # View a report (e.g., *Created vs Resolved*)
 # Find a day where a subtask was created or resolved
 # Observe the *Summary* of the subtask

h3. Expected Results
The subtask's *Summary* should show.

h3. Actual Results
The parent's issue key is show as the *Summary* for the subtask.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Viewing the results of a Report shows the parent issue key instead of the sub-task Summary

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

As an Admin, I like the new Organization feature in JIRA Service Desk. However, I have thousands of customers who already exist. Adding them one by one to Organizations is time-consuming.

h3. Suggested Solution

Give Admins the ability to add customers to Organizations in bulk.
 
h3. Workaround

Create a .csv of users by exporting all customers from the User Management, then copy/paste emails from that into the Add to Organization field or use this API endpoint to [add customers into organizations|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/rest/#api-rest-servicedeskapi-organization-organizationId-user-post].
fields.summary: Bulk add existing customers to organizations

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When user logs in to the JIRA Service Desk portal, and uses a saved password the password field disappears ( [^Screen Recording 2020-06-22 at 16.46.50.mov]) and for few users after filling the username the password field is just not appearing it flickers ( [^IMG_9076.MOV] )
macOS 10.14.6 and 10.15.5 with SAFARI 13.1.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login to the Jira Service Desk portal and save the password for the first time.
 # Now logout, and login again, this time used the saved password.

h3. Expected Results
The password field should take the saved password.
h3. Actual Results
Password field disappears 

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Password field disappears when try to use a saved password in SAFARI browser.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

By default, when the project open to public, any existing customer should be visible and searchable in the project customer list. However, for some specific customer accounts case the agents in a project are unable to search for them via URL or name via the "Customers" page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set the project open to anyone
 # Go to the project customer page.
 # Search the customer using the email address, for example (abc@yahoo.com) or their profile name if they have one that is different to the email.

h3. Expected Results

User listed in the customer page.
h3. Actual Results

The result return "Customer not found".
h3. Workaround

Get the admin to edit a customer's full name (add a full stop or something then edit again to remove it)

1. Go to "Adtlassian Admin: User management" then in the LHS of nav -> "Jira Service Desk"
2. Find the customer account by email
3. "Edit Full Name" -> make a minor change (eg: add a full stop "." after the name)
4. Reverse the change
fields.summary: Unable to search customer at Customer page even though the project open to public

fields.description:
h3. Problem

There is no configuration for creating incoming webhooks in Jira, only outgoing. This would be good to have the ability to create incoming webhooks for creating issues for example.

h3. Suggested resolution

Allow incoming webhooks to be configured to create issues in Jira
fields.summary: Allow incoming webhooks to be configured to create issues in Jira

fields.description: It's not possible to use the "Open in New Tab" option of any browser on customer organizations anymore. This option is useful for projects with a large number of organizations.
fields.summary: Bring back the ability to open a customer organization in a new tab

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Navigate to new Service Desk project
 # Go to Reports > Created vs. Resolved or any custom report with data showing
 # Change the timescale to "Past year by month", X-axis label labels will show correctly as the months that are relevant (eg "Jun", "July" etc)
 # In the nav switch to another report with data

h3. Expected results

The X-Axis looks exactly the same since the timescale didn't change
h3. Actual results

The X-Axis shows the 1st of each month instead (eg: "1st Jun", "1st July") 
h3. Workaround
 # Refresh the page on the desired report
 # Change the timescale to "Past year by month"
 (it will work only for the first report viewed)
fields.summary: X-axis labels on custom reports display incorrectly when user navigates between reports after changing timescale to "Past year by month"

fields.description:
h3. Summary

New Service Desk projects (such as "General Service Desk") are shipped with a few issue types associated with the read-only Jira workflow by default. However, in spite of being associated with a workflow scheme/project, the Jira workflow remains inactive.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Jira Service Desk project using the "General Service Desk" template.
# Go to Project settings > Workflows. Notice that  "jira" is associated with a few issue types".  
!image-2020-06-26-16-34-28-377.png|thumbnail! 
# The same is visible in the Workflow schemes page.  
!image-2020-06-26-16-35-04-922.png|thumbnail! 
# Although associated with the scheme, the workflow still appears as *inactive* in the Worflows page. 
 !image-2020-06-26-16-35-34-693.png|thumbnail! 



h3. Side effects

If you want to create a Kanban board for your Jira Service Desk project, you'll be unable to map statuses from the jira workflow on the Kanban columns.

h3.Workaround
Go to the workflow schemes page, remove and manually assign Jira workflow to the scheme again.
fields.summary: New JSD Projects are not activating the Jira default workflow

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When an email is firstly invited as a customer and then as an Atlassian Account, they will end up with duplicated accounts. Customers in that condition will be asked to "Login with single sign-on" because of the Atlassian Account. If the Atlassian account is then disabled, Jira will still ask the user to "Login with single sign-on" even if the only active account now is the portal only one, which authenticates directly in Jira with username and password.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a portal only account;
# Invite the same email as an Atlassian Account;
# Disable the Atlassian Account;
# Try to log in to the customer portal.

h3. Expected Results
Jira will present the password field since the Atlassian Account is disabled and the email is now a portal only account.

h3. Actual Results
Jira still asks the customer to "Login with single sign-on", but since the Atlassian account is disabled, they won't be able to log into the portal.
- https://share.getcloudapp.com/8Lu79ApN

h3. Workaround
Delete the Atlassian Account at <instance>.atlassian.com/admin or migrate the customer account to Atlassian Account and remove all the application accesses.
fields.summary: Customers with duplicated accounts (Atlassian Account + Portal Only) are required SSO even if the AA is disabled

fields.description:
h3. *Problem*

Currently, it's not possible to export the audit log of Automations (both JSD Automation and Project automation).
h3. *Suggestion*

Add the ability to export the audit log for better analysis and a better view of the details of each execution.
fields.summary: Ability to export Automation Audit logs
